business.headline: Zomato share price rises 3%. Check target price, 52-week high, buy or sell?Today's gain comes on the back of developments such as Goldman Sachs buying a stake in Zomato and a report indicating that the company has laid off 600 customer support employees.

Unified Pension Scheme now open for NPS subscribers. Here's how to applyCentral government employees who have worked for more than 10 years are entitled to a guaranteed pension of Rs 10,000 per month. Additionally, those with 10–25 years of service will receive a pension that is in line with the years they served.

Explained: Why Tata Consumer Products share price gained 8% todayAt around 11:34 am, shares were trading 7.47% higher at Rs 1,066 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), after hitting an intraday high of Rs 1,073.55 earlier in the session.

Manufacturing activity in March expands at fastest pace in 8 monthsThe HSBC India Manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI), compiled by S&P Global, bounced to 58.1 in March from 56.3 in February, higher than a preliminary estimate of 57.6 and firmly above 50.0 which separates growth from contraction.

Sensex jumps 500 points: Why stock market is rising despite tariff concernsStock market today: The main indices on Dalal Street opened on a positive note on Wednesday despite concerns over Donald Trump's 'Liberation Day' tariff announcement.

White House confirms new reciprocal tariffs set to begin soonThe White House has confirmed that new reciprocal tariffs are set to begin in the next few hours. Donald Trump stated that India is likely to reduce its tariffs. The President's economic vision aims to improve American competitiveness, reduce trade deficits, and protect economic and national security. India is taking a wait-and-watch approach to assess the impact of these tariffs before considering any retaliation.

Countdown begins for Trump's 'Liberation Day' tariffs: What's at stake?Uncertainty grows as the world braces for Donald Trump's 'Liberation Day' tariffs. Global stock markets are volatile, major economies face tough choices, and fears of a trade war threaten to disrupt global commerce.

'Dirty 15' list: Which countries will suffer most from Trump's tariffs?The Trump administration has claimed that existing trade rules favour other countries at the expense of the US, and the new tariffs are seen as a response to these concerns.
Sensex gains 400 points, Nifty climbs as tariff impact fails to rattle D-StreetThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 436.11 points to 76,460.62, while NSE Nifty50 added 106.30 points to 23,272.00 as of 9:34 am.

Sensex, Nifty opening today: What to expect from D-Street on Trump tariff day?Nifty and Sensex fell 1.5% and 1.8%, respectively, in the last session, marking their biggest single-day percentage fall in a month.

Stocks to watch on April 2: Shares in focus; Tata Motors, Swiggy, Coal IndiaShares of companies such as Maruti Suzuki, Tata Motors, Tata Steel, Tata Consumer, Swiggy, Godavari Power, and Indian Bank will be in focus due to key developments.

New Income Tax rules: Know all rates, slabs, deductions and moreThe government has amended the income tax slabs under the new tax regime for FY 2025-26. According to the new structure, those earning up to Rs 4 lakh will pay no taxes.

entertainment.headline: John Wick animated film in works, Keanu Reeves likely to voiceHollywood actor Keanu Reeves will most likely be returning to voice the character of John Wick in its animated prequel.

Did Empuraan composer Deepak Dev leak Lucifer Part 3 title?L2: Empuraan composer Deepak Dev opened up about the title of Lucifer Part 3 in a recent interview. He talked about how there is a hint regarding the title in the climax of Empuraan.
Kajol's cheeky birthday wish for Ajay Devgn: All cool people were born in AugustActor Kajol has shared a fun birthday wish for her husband Ajay Devgn. Devgn turned 55 on Wednesday.

Shalini Pandey on comparisons with Alia Bhatt: I want to have my own individualityIn a candid chat, Shalini Pandey addressed comparisons with Alia Bhatt, emphasising her desire for individuality in the film industry.

High stakes, higher hopes: Ranbir, Alia, Vicky's box office tryst with Love & War'Love & War' is going to be a big gamble for Alia Bhatt, Ranbir Kapoor and Vicky Kaushal at the box office. The Sanjay Leela Bhansali film boasts grandeur like his previous magnum opus, but this time, the starcast makes it look bigger than what it is.

Aishwarya-Abhishek's Kajra Re performance lights up family wedding. WatchAbhishek Bachchan and Aishwarya Rai's videos and pictures from a wedding have gone viral. One of the clips featured the couple, along with their daughter, dancing to Kajra Re.

Laapataa Ladies faces plagiarism claims over similarities with Arabic filmKiran Rao's Laapataa Ladies recently faced plagiarism claims after a viral video showed its resemblance to the 2019 Arabic film Burqa City. The Kiran Rao directorial was released in theatres on March 1, 2024.

Val Kilmer, actor who played Batman and Jim Morrison, dies of pneumonia at 65American actor Val Kilmer died at the age of 65. His daughter, Mercedes Kilmer, said that the cause of death was pneumonia.

Would a show like Adolescence be approved in India? Sudhir Mishra weighs inFilm director Sudhir Mishra questioned Adolescence's Netflix India success, calling it "the best news in years." He said India must produce stories of such quality instead of dumbing down content for audiences.
Singer Vishal Dadlani slams Studio Ghibli trendSinger-composer Vishal Dadalni recently criticised the Studio Ghibli trend on social media. He called it 'AI Plagiarisation.'

Empuraan box office Day 6: Mohanlal's film sees drop, eyes Rs 100 crore in IndiaMohanlal's L2: Empuraan, directed by Prithviraj Sukumaran, saw a slight drop in numbers on Tuesday. The film is marching towards Rs 100 crore nett at the domestic box office.

Salman Khan's Sikandar sees drop after decent start, earns Rs 19.5 crore on Day 3Sikandar box office collection Day 3: Salman Khan's film collected Rs 19.5 crore on Tuesday, bringing its total to Rs 74.5 crore in India. The film faces competition from Mohanlal's L2: Empuraan.

Keanu Reeves to return as hitman in John Wick Chapter 5Actor Keanu Reeves and director Chad Stahelski are set to reunite for John Wick: Chapter 5. The upcoming installment was announced at CinemaCon in Las Vegas.

Apoorva Mukhija deletes all Instagram pics months after India's Got Latent rowInfluencer and actor Apoorva Mukhija deleted her Instagram posts months after India's Got Latent controversy. Popularly known as The Rebel kid, she faced charges over her vulgar and offensive comments on the show.

Mohanlal-starrer Empuraan's re-edited version out in theatres after 24 cutsThe re-edited version of actor Mohanlal and director Prithviraj Sukumaran's L2: Empuraan was screened in theatres on Tuesday. The makers voluntarily went for re-censoring and the censor board suggested 24 cuts, including deletion of two minutes of footage.

Sydney Sweeney splits from fiancé Jonathan Davino: Here's whySydney Sweeney has ended her engagement to Jonathan Davino, prioritising her career over wedding plans. The Madame Webb star is focused on upcoming projects, including Euphoria and The Housemaid.

Docuseries on Justin Baldoni, Blake Lively's legal feud in worksA docuseries on the legal battle between actors Blake Lively and Justin Baldoni's will be available on Discovery, promising an intriguing look into the complexities of legal disputes.
Jennifer Lawrence welcomes second child with husband Cooke MaroneyActor Jennifer Lawrence welcomed her second child with her husband Cooke Maroney. The got married in October 2019.

Zoe Saldaña joins Kendrick Lamar and Gracie Abrams in Webby nominationsWith nearly 13,000 entries from over 70 countries, the competition includes viral music videos, top podcasts, and unexpected social media sensations. Voting for the Webby People's Voice Award is open until April 17, with winners announced on April 22.

general news.headline: Even Parliament building could have been claimed as Waqf: Kiren Rijiju slams UPAThe Waqf bill, which seeks to amend the Waqf Act of 1995 that governs the management of properties donated by Muslims, was tabled in Parliament by minister Kiren Rijiju amid uproar.

Live: RS Prasad claims Opposition wants amendment, forced to oppose Waqf BillWaqf Amendment Bill Live Updates: The Lok Sabha on Tuesday started the debate on the contentious Waqf (Amendment) Bill, with the government resolute in pushing it forward while the Opposition standing united in denouncing it as 'unconstitutional'. The bill is expected to reach the Rajya Sabha on Thursday, with both Houses allotted eight hours each for deliberations. Key NDA allies — Telugu Desam Party (TDP), Janata Dal (United), Shiv Sena (Eknath Shinde), and LJP (Ram Vilas) — have issued whips directing their MPs to back the government's position. Meanwhile, the opposition INDIA bloc showcased a united front on Wednesday, strategising its collective resistance to the bill in a meeting held at Parliament House. Follow indiatoday.in for more updates.

Pak army attempts to cross LoC, 4-5 infiltrators killed in Indian firing: SourcesThe Indian Army successfully thwarted an infiltration attempt by the Pakistan Army in the Krishna Ghati area of Poonch district.

This is how Earth's poles look from space. First-ever video is hereElon Musk remarked on the significance of this flight, stating, "This is the first time humans have been in orbit around the poles of Earth."

Waqf Bill won't snatch lands, Opposition inciting Muslims: Kiren Rijiju in Lok SabhaKiren Rijiju criticised the Opposition for spreading misinformation, highlighted past government actions regarding waqf properties, and questioned the 2013 amendment that allowed non-Muslims to create waqf.

Deja vu? Sanjiv Goenka confronts Rishabh Pant, shades of KL Rahul momentLucknow Super Giants (LSG) owner Sanjiv Goenka was seen having an intense chat with captain Rishabh Pant following their eight-wicket loss against Punjab Kings (PBKS).

Why Ayodhya-style Ram temple is coming up in Mamata's political nursery NandigramBengal BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari will be laying the foundation of an Ayodhya-style Ram temple in Nandigram, the epicentre of Mamata Banerjee's movement that saw her rise to power. BJP members' chanting of "Jai Shri Ram" has often evoked strong reactions from the Trinamool Congress chief. This is the politics behind the temple.

sports.headline: Hay, Sears crush Pakistan by 84 runs in 2nd ODI as New Zealand seal series 2-0New Zealand beat Pakistan by 84 runs in the second ODI of the three-match series on Wednesday, April 2 at Seddon Park, Hamilton. Mitchell Hay (99) and Ben Sears (5/59) guided the hosts to a comprehensive win.

NBA: Nikola Jokić scores career-high 61 points but falls short as Timberwolves edge Nuggets in 2OT thrillerNikola Jokic scored a career-high 61 points; however, the Denver Nuggets still fell short in a double-overtime thriller against the Minnesota Timberwolves in a regular NBA game on Tuesday, April 1, at Ball Arena, losing 140-139.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP.
